title: WCAS AF_AM_ST 380-0-1 Topics in African-American Studies
topic: Theories of Black Gender and Black Sexuality

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course will provide an introduction to conversations in the field of Black Studies that grapple with theories of blackness, as they relate to the concepts of gender, and to a lesser degree, sexuality. The course will use sound recordings, visual art, and performance art to facilitate emerging conversations around the relationship of blackness to conceptualizations of gender and sexuality.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value:
? Attendance, 15%
? In-class participation, including in-class free writing, 15%
? Midterm essay, 35%
? Final group project, 35%

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Mock, Janet. Redefining Realness: My Path to Womanhood, Identity, Love & so Much More. First Atria Books. New York: Atria Books, 2014.
